Thought: To create a Ruby function that checks if a number is prime, we'll define a method called `is_prime` that takes an integer parameter. The function will iterate from 2 to the square root of the number, checking if any number in that range divides the given number evenly. If it finds a divisor, it returns false; otherwise, it returns true.

```ruby
def is_prime(number)
  return false if number <= 1
  
  (2..Math.sqrt(number)).any? { |i| number % i == 0 }
end
```
